New Records: Paul Skenes became the fourth pitcher in MLB history to finish a season with a sub-2.00 ERA while averaging 11 or more strikeouts per nine innings.
Paul Skenes became the first rookie pitcher to record at least 23 starts with a sub-2.00 ERA in a single season since Scott Perry in 1918.
Paul Skenes set a new franchise record for the Pirates with opponents posting only a .198 batting average against him, the lowest by a Pirates starter all-time.
Key Match Events: Paul Skenes struck out three Yankees hitters, including superstars Juan Soto and Aaron Judge, in two scoreless innings.
Mike Burrows made his MLB debut in the third inning and preserved Skenes' no-hitter bid until the fifth inning.
Jazz Chisholm Jr. hit his 24th home run of the season against Mike Burrows.
The Pirates hit five home runs in the game, with Nick Gonzales, Yasmani Grandal, Billy Cook, Jared Triolo, and Nick Yorke all going deep.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Derek Shelton and the coaching staff met with Paul Skenes in St. Louis to inform him he had seven innings remaining in his season.
Post-Match Reflections: Paul Skenes expressed satisfaction with his season and mentioned his focus on finishing strong.
Mike Burrows reflected on his MLB debut, stating it was everything he could have dreamed of.
Manager Derek Shelton praised Skenes for his exceptional rookie season and sub-2.00 ERA.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played on a blustery, damp Saturday afternoon at Yankee Stadium.
The Yankees had clinched a postseason spot the night before the series started.
